Since Sphinx 1.6 released, pbr's build_sphinx extension has been broken.
Specifically, pbr's [build_sphinx]/builders option is ignored. Luckily,
sphinx itself ipmlemented the feature but called it just 'builder'[1].
This patch fixes the config setting name and then cleans up a Sphinx
extension inclusion that is now automatically included.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-July/119396.html

Change-Id: I5da6a996ed442524ddb108a890df2d024ee07c4d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix man page builds

Since Sphinx 1.6 released, pbr's build_sphinx extension has been broken.
Specifically, pbr's [build_sphinx]/builders option is ignored. Luckily,
sphinx itself ipmlemented the feature but called it just 'builder'[1].
This patch fixes the config setting name and then cleans up a Sphinx
extension inclusion that is now automatically included.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-July/119396.html

Change-Id: I5da6a996ed442524ddb108a890df2d024ee07c4d

added_lines: I'm announcing my candidacy to continue as the PTL for Searchlight for the Queens cycle. I've been a core contributor since the project began and PTL since the start of the Ocata cycle. My goals for Queens are mainly to try to increase community involvement and usage. We have some interesting ideas in the works for integrating with Zaqar and Horizon, and I also want to continue to improve the way we ingest data. I look forward to hopefully continuing as PTL for Queens! Steve McLellan

subject: Set OVH max-servers to 0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-07 18:32:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b11426c29ac1a2ad279d534560cdb60f266544bd', 'message': "Set OVH BHS1 max-servers to 1

This region is currently failing to boot any nodes. The response from
nova is an HTTP 500 error code with:

  'Error in creating the server: Timed out waiting for a reply to
   message ID $ID'

Setting this to 1 will reduce the load we put on that service (possibly
aiding in recovery) and will allow nodepool to properly schedule demand
in regions where we expect to have successful boots.

Change-Id: I313bfb01dc3c1cba077677431e65fb21753dbf46
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-07 18:48:25.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/4c2d691a8399dbb37497decf869d5776b1cae404', 'message': "Set OVH max-servers to 0

BHS1 is currently failing to boot any nodes. The response from
nova is an HTTP 500 error code with:

  'Error in creating the server: Timed out waiting for a reply to
   message ID $ID'

They have apparently cancelled our service? Set max-servers to 0 until
it is sorted out.

Change-Id: I313bfb01dc3c1cba077677431e65fb21753dbf46
"}]
commit_message:
Set OVH max-servers to 0

BHS1 is currently failing to boot any nodes. The response from
nova is an HTTP 500 error code with:

  'Error in creating the server: Timed out waiting for a reply to
   message ID $ID'

They have apparently cancelled our service? Set max-servers to 0 until
it is sorted out.

Change-Id: I313bfb01dc3c1cba077677431e65fb21753dbf46

commit_message:
Restructure the documentation according the new spec

Group the existing pages in the new top-level categories; each
category can be seen as a separate document and it has its own
index file.
The content of the pages was not changed, with the obvious
exception of the links between pages.

The autogenerated configuration has not been added yet to
configuration/; it will be fixed in a future commit.

At the same time, as suggested by the doc team, consistently
use only one separator in file names (dash, '-') instead of a mix
of dashes, dots and underscores. This may break even more links on
the Internet, but we are breaking them anyway by moving files.
Redirects can be set, but not in this commit.

Closes-Bug: #1706184
Change-Id: I5a10378d9da2603d617ad4193ea8d90e2afc5104

commit_message:
Remove cinder v1 client usages

Cinder v1 API tests have been removed completely since the commit
I04de2d90fe11f8ec4acbfa983bc0ad3aa979f45b So we don't need to keep
cinder v1 client calls anymore.

Change-Id: I04ae50cfb6e704a81ae62e2057e6b33007ba277a

commit_message:
Support setting rpc-response-timeout and report-interval

These two options are set in neutron-api charm centrally,
this patch allows neutron-gateway charm to continue doing:

1, rpc_response_timeout
   Used by all neutron agents, so both neutron-gateway charm and
   neutron-openvswitch charm get it via it's relations and set it
   in [default] of neutron.conf

2, report_interval
   Used by all neutron agents, so both neutron-gateway charm and
   neutron-openvswitch charm get it via it's relations and set it
   in [agent] of neutron.conf

This patch also syncs charmhelpers for setting them centrally.

Change-Id: Ib97418b1aaf55f508cae05f4d7809d79a92a7f6f
Partial-Bug: #1685788
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-gateway refs/changes/44/480344/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support polling-interval rpc-response-timeout and report-interval

This patch adds support for setting polling-interval rpc-response-timeout
and report-interval in neutron-api charm centrally, then other charms
need to continue doing:

1, polling_interval
   Just used by neutron l2 agents, so neutron-openvswitch charm
   gets it via its relations and set it in [agent] of ml2_conf.ini
   or openvswitch_agent.ini(>=Mitaka)

2, rpc_response_timeout
   Used by all neutron agents, so both neutron-gateway charm and
   neutron-openvswitch charm get it via its relations and set it
   in [default] of neutron.conf

3, report_interval
   Used by all neutron agents, so both neutron-gateway charm and
   neutron-openvswitch charm get it via its relations and set it
   in [agent] of neutron.conf

This patch also syncs charmhelpers.

Change-Id: I669e959a596b214acf486b0532c4ab31c2b82557
Partial-Bug: #1685788
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api refs/changes/42/480342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: polling-interval: type: int default: 2 description: | The number of seconds the agent will wait between polling for local device changes. rpc-response-timeout: type: int default: 60 description: | Seconds to wait for a response from a call. report-interval: type: int default: 30 description: | Seconds between nodes reporting state to server; should be less than agent_down_time, best if it is half or less than agent_down_time.

commit_message:
Add protection against no local facts being defined

If there are no local facts, the initialisation of
facts fails due to ansible_local being undefined.

This patch adds a conditional for that situation and
als makes the task set slightly more code-efficient.

commit_message:
Add a release note of the new instance reservation feature

Partially implements: blueprint new-instance-reservation

Change-Id: I8065118fca5588e89888ef11888696886573d379
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/03/488303/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | The new instance reservation feature is released at Pike release. The feature enables a user to reserve instance slots on hypervisors for the future usage. A user creates a lease for an instance reservation in advance, then the reservation ensures he/she can create their instances within the reservation. For the details of its instruction, read the blazar documentation.

Pass packages as a list

This patch passes a list of packages to the package module
rather than using "with_items" and it should speed up the
package installation process.

commit_message:
Add NTP configuration for the CoreOS image

Adds NTP setup to the CoreOS image. The servers to use are
configurable by setting ``ntpservers=foo,bar`` on the kernel
command line (where ``foo`` and ``bar`` are ntp servers).
This also sets the hardware clock after running ntpdate, as some
deployments only hard reboot the server after deployment and
the shutdown job to sync the clock won't run.

Partial-Bug: #1619054
Change-Id: I1fbc587003bbac35fef775d59f509931db28d999
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/46/361146/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash IP=4.2.2.1 I=0 while true; do I=$((I + 1)) if ip route get $IP; then echo "Found route on $I run through" echo "Printing IP information:" ip a ip r break else echo "No route found on $I run through, sleeping" sleep 1 fi done SERVERS=`cat /proc/cmdline | awk '{ for(i=1;i<=NF;i++) { if ($i ~ /^ntpservers=/) { print substr($i, 12); exit 0 } } }' | sed 's/,/ /g'` if [[ -z "$SERVERS" ]]; then echo "Failed to find ntpservers= on command line" # Fail softly if kernel command line is not configured exit 0 fi # Delete existing config; it is a symlink into /usr so we can't write to it rm /etc/ntp.conf for server in $SERVERS; do echo "server $server" >> /etc/ntp.conf done echo "restrict default nomodify nopeer noquery limited kod" >> /etc/ntp.conf echo "restrict 127.0.0.1" >> /etc/ntp.conf echo "restrict [::1]" >> /etc/ntp.conf echo "NTP Configuration successfully generated, running ntpdate" # Setting time ntpdate -u $SERVERS # Specifically set hw clock, since we hard reboot the shutdown job to sync # will never run hwclock --systohc

commit_message:
Add spec for image caching to nodes via agent driver

Change-Id: Ie9ed0c3f0505c8681febd4b0d1f46e4ed2c25148
Partial-Bug: 1575249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/94/310594/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================== Support Image Caching in Agent Driver ===================================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1575249 Adds support for image caching in agent driver. Problem description =================== Ironic-Python-Agent currently supports caching images to nodes via the Standby extension. By adding support for image caching in Ironic's agent driver, Ironic operators would be able to conveniently instruct nodes to cache an image through Ironic, while maintaining a record of which nodes have images cached. Image caching can significantly improve node provisioning times, enabling a more elastic bare-metal cloud. Proposed change =============== Create a vendor passthru endpoint in the agent driver called ``cache_image``. ``cache_image`` will be fed image information which will be used to instruct the agent on what image to cache. A record will be made of the state of the caching operation and what image is being cached to ``driver_info`` so the agent driver can drive the ansynchronous operation to completion, and allow operators and other external observers to see the state of the node's cache. This will also allow aggregate management of an ironic cell's cache across nodes. Due to the asynchronous nature of the operation, additional handling functions will be needed, as well as modification of the ``heartbeat`` function in the agent driver, in order to check the status of the cache operation and determine if the operation completed successfully or resulted in an error. Clean up of caching related metadata will be handled when a node is sent through cleaning. Alternatives ------------ Nova has the capability to cache images to hypervisors and manage that cache, but Ironic's case is significantly different since it only makes sense to store one image per node. Data model impact ----------------- Add caching related meta-data to the ``driver_info`` and ``driver_internal_info`` fields found at node-level data. Including: * The current state of the cache operation. * The UUID of the image cached to the node. * Any errors the cache operation encountered. No database-level changes required. State Machine Impact -------------------- A node in the ``AVAILABLE`` state could be instructed to perform a cache operation. REST API impact --------------- Allow vendor-passthru to call the ``cache_image`` function added to the agent driver. ``cache_image`` proposed properties: * Will instruct a node's agent to cache a specified image, and cause the agent driver to ansychronously monitor the operation until its completion. * POST method type. * Requires the following information in POSTed in JSON format:: { "image_info": { "id": "image_uuid", "urls": "URL to retrieve image here.", "checksum": "The checksum of the image." } } * Returns normal vendor-passthru HTTP response codes. * Possible errors: * Image information JSON dictionary does not contain the required information to complete the cache operation. * Node is not in the ``AVAILABLE`` state. * Node is in maintenance. * Node is already in the middle of a caching operation, or already has an image cached. * Ironic is unable to verify the image's URL. * Endpoint URL is ``http://<address>:<port>/<version>/nodes/<node UUID>/vendor_passthru/cache_image`` The API microversion should increment to show the addition of the ``cache_image`` endpoint. Client (CLI) impact ------------------- An addition to the CLI client might be nice for convenience for the end-user/ operator, but not necessary. "ironic" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~ If a ``cache_image`` command were added it would probably look like the following:: ironic cache_image <node_uuid> <image_uuid> <image_url> <image_checksum> "openstack baremetal" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ See change to "ironic" CLI. RPC API impact -------------- No RPC API impact. Driver API impact ----------------- No Driver API impact. Nova driver impact ------------------ There is no need for Nova driver impact. Security impact --------------- No expected security impact. Other end user impact --------------------- Users may use an external program to automatically manage the cache of images on a fleet of Ironic nodes. Arsenal, for example, provides this functionality. Scalability impact ------------------ No known scalability impact. Performance Impact ------------------ The most notable performance impact would typically be significantly shorter provisioning times to nodes with a requested image already cached. The only major shift here is when an image is downloaded and written to an agent-managed node. Other deployer impact --------------------- This should be a relatively low-impact change for deployers. A deployer that wishes to ignore image caching functionality will find it easy to do so. If operators wish to take advantage of the caching functionality they can build an external automation tool to call the ``cache_image`` endpoint appropriately. Or an operator can take advantage of an existing solution, such as Arsenal. If an operator decides to use Arsenal, then they would need to deploy it as a service running along-side Ironic, which would need to have access to Ironic and Glance at a minimum. Developer impact ---------------- Discuss things that will affect other developers working on OpenStack, such as: * If the blueprint proposes a change to the driver API, discussion of how other drivers would implement the feature is required. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Clifton Houck (me@clifhouck.com) <f-te-u> Work Items ---------- * Agent driver modifications to support and drive cache operation. * API microversion update? * CLI update? * Documentation update. Dependencies ============ * Depends on image caching implmented in standby extension of Ironic-Python-Agent. Testing ======= Addition of tempest tests around caching. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== Should not break backwards compability in any way. Documentation Impact ==================== Short documentation of ``cache_image`` endpoint. References ==========

commit_message:
Fix haproxy_check_script for delete listener

When delete one of the listeners in active standby mode,
the haproxy_check_script should be update too.
Delete method dose not have an action and according to the
defination of vrrp_check_script_update, the action should be
consts.AMP_ACTION_STOP to remove from listener_ids.
This path will fix keepalived in fault state by updating the
haproxy_check_script.

Change-Id: I4e0ca1b415b974c2784727378453daeb5149dc6d
Closes-Bug: 1705288
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/94/490294/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Since this script should be deleted at LB delete time # we can check for this path to see if VRRP is enabled # on this amphora and not write the file if VRRP is not in use if os.path.exists(util.keepalived_check_script_path()): self.vrrp_check_script_update( listener_id, action=consts.AMP_ACTION_STOP)

commit_message:
Store agent driver’s internal fields in driver_internal_info

The agent driver currently stores its internal data in the
node.instance_info field. Since the end-user shouldn’t access this
data, this information is now stored in the node.driver_internal_info
field.
The fields moved from node.instance_info to node.driver_internal_info
are: image_url, image_checksum, image_disk_format,
image_container_format, image_tags, image_properties, kernel,
ramdisk, image_type.

Change-Id: Ic6bc052376d15234b73d1c4f813b0752054f3550
Closes-Bug: #1613903
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/91/408691/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add subunit output format

This commit adds support to bandit to generate a subunit stream
output reflecting the results of the run. It treats the subunit test
id as the filename with the check name  in '[]' appended to the end.
The default test runners (namely testr) used by other OpenStack
projects emit subunit streams. These are being used in a variety of
different ways so adding initial support to bandit to do the same is
a good start.

Change-Id: Idcb8463fe8b313bb2e4b8b96afc77afa7866eeb3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/84/186884/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adding a ipxe_boot_sleep parameter

A sleep of 5-10 seconds are needed by some of the
converged network adapters(CNA) while ipxe boot in
UEFI mode before booting. So adding a parameter
ipxe_boot_sleep under pxe group to manually add sleep
time whenever there is necessity.

Change-Id: I4bb88b2aaf8c274d1656d1a9add37b87b2ceacd4
Closes-bug: 1625443
Co-Authored-By: Bharath Kumar <shettybharath4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Trim invalid characters from token authentication

This change adds whitespace character stripping for
token authentication. This removes invalid characters
such as carriage returns from X-Auth-Tokens that would
cause keystone to see the token as invalid and return
a 401 unauthorized response when the actual token value
was valid.

Co-Authored-By: Kelly Hall <kh928q@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Gage Hugo <gagehugo@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I0073980b3f399b02bee86180fa91b741a6fd4d05
Closes-Bug: #1689468

commit_message:
Ceph: Fix Multinode Gates

This PS should make the multinode gate more reliable for ceph.

It's not perfect in that is uses the default route IPs in zuul, which
has a performance hit. The bash is also ugly as sin - but it gets us
moving again until somone has time to implement a more eligant solution
that works both in infra supplied nodes and other CI systems.

Change-Id: Ie1326f048c43d04a945ca155bde8824d17ddcbec

added_lines: function find_multi_subnet_range { : ${PRIMARY_NODE_IP:="$(cat /etc/nodepool/primary_node_private | tail -1)"} : ${SUB_NODE_IPS:="$(cat /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private)"} NODE_IPS="${PRIMARY_NODE_IP} ${SUB_NODE_IPS}" NODE_IP_UNSORTED=$(mktemp --suffix=.txt) for NODE_IP in $NODE_IPS; do echo $NODE_IP >> ${NODE_IP_UNSORTED} done NODE_IP_SORTED=$(mktemp --suffix=.txt) sort -V ${NODE_IP_UNSORTED} > ${NODE_IP_SORTED} rm -f ${NODE_IP_UNSORTED} FIRST_IP_SUBNET=$(ipcalc "$(head -n 1 ${NODE_IP_SORTED})/24" | awk '/^Network/ { print $2 }') LAST_IP_SUBNET=$(ipcalc "$(tail -n 1 ${NODE_IP_SORTED})/24" | awk '/^Network/ { print $2 }') rm -f ${NODE_IP_SORTED} function ip_diff { echo $(($(echo $LAST_IP_SUBNET | awk -F '.' "{ print \$$1}") - $(echo $FIRST_IP_SUBNET | awk -F '.' "{ print \$$1}"))) } for X in {1..4}; do if ! [ "$(ip_diff $X)" -eq "0" ]; then SUBMASK=$(((($X - 1 )) * 8)) break fi done echo ${FIRST_IP_SUBNET%/*}/${SUBMASK} }

commit_message:
Replace deprecated test.attr with decorators.attr

Tempest has deprecated decorator 'tempest.test.attr' and
moved the same as stable interface to 'tempest.lib.decorators
.attr' in version 16.1.0.

Let's use the stable interface for attr decorator.
This will help Tempest to remove the deprecated decorator.

Also add the dependency of Tempest in test_requirements.txt

Change-Id: I71c494221c7ecf127280d13ef40ad3b022a5afa6

commit_message:
Add api_container metagroup

The `api_container` group provides a way to specifically target
OpenStack API containers without providing a long, complicated host
string to an Ansible playbook's `host` setting.

While this targetting is possible currently, the strings to exclude
containers like MariaDB, RabbitMQ, and memcached containers are somewhat
long and repetitive, thus reducing readability and raising the risk of
related bugs.

Change-Id: I141e5643b665db593f544e85f89f0d79ec870707
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/03/464703/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #/usr/bin/env python populate_api_container(inventory)def populate_api_container(inventory): """Create a group holding all OpenStack API containers. This inventory passed in will be mutated so that any host in a group named "*_api_container" will copied into the "api_container" group. :param inventory: dictionary containing the Ansible inventory """ api_containers = [] for group, members in inventory.items(): # Not actually a 'leaf' group, or a group at all if 'hosts' not in members: continue if group.endswith('_api_container'): for host in members['hosts']: appended = du.append_if(api_containers, item=host) if appended: logger.debug("Host %s from %s added to api_containers group", (host, group)) inventory['api_container'] = {'hosts': api_containers} logger.debug("Created api_containe group")

commit_message:
replace b3 release type in new-release with milestone

Update new-release to understand how to compute milestone release
version numbers.

Change-Id: I2a7936a4bd00c906ba45b179b074b42946636d5c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
defines the Hyper-V Security Groups Driver as a neutron firewall driver

This change allows users to configure the neutron-hyperv-agent with
"firewall_driver=hyperv" instead of the full classpath.

Change-Id: I86fff5784b7f04decd8b99e3b0774fbb89367232

commit_message:
add rc handling to new-release

Compute release candidate versions in new-release. Add the stable
branch when creating the first release candidate.

Change-Id: I1b73154f0bfc1a2c877ff1ee09f3320bff1620a3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/06/491506/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: choices=('bugfix', 'feature', 'major', 'b3', 'rc'), first_rc = False elif args.release_type == 'rc': force_tag = True if deliverable_info['release-model'] != 'cycle-with-milestones': raise ValueError('Cannot compute RC for {} project {}'.format( deliverable_info['release-model'], args.deliverable)) new_version_parts = last_version[:-1] if 'b' in last_version[-1]: # First RC new_version_parts.append('0rc1') first_rc = True else: next_rc = int(last_version[-1][3:]) + 1 new_version_parts.append('0rc{}'.format(next_rc)) if first_rc: deliverable_info.setdefault('branches', []).append({ 'name': 'stable/{}'.format(series), 'location': new_version, })

commit_message:
add --force option to new-release

By default new-release skips repos that are already tagged at the HEAD
of the branch. This flag overrides that behavior so that multi-part
deliverables have all parts tagged together. The flag is also set for
b3 release types, since those are milestone-based.

Change-Id: I221325ca43eda4da183707978eb520c099b40a3f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/05/491505/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '--force', default=False, action='store_true', help=('force a new tag, even if the HEAD of the ' branch is already tagged'), ) parser.add_argument( force_tag = args.force force_tag = True if project['hash'] != sha or force_tag: else: print('{} already tagged at most recent commit, skipping'.format( project['repo']))

commit_message:
Add a user guide for the new instance reservation feature

Partially implements: blueprint new-instance-reservation

Change-Id: I9d7e8e689a8a86366fc59cd643c7a53e01dadf73
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/04/488304/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Using Instance Reservation ========================== Prerequisites ------------- The following packages should be installed: * blazar * blazar-nova * python-blazarclient The four filter scheduler should be configured in nova.conf: * AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter * AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation * ServerGroupAffinityFilter * BlazarFilter 1. Add hosts into the freepool ------------------------------ 1. Add hosts into the Blazar freepool using the host-create command: .. sourcecode:: console blazar host-create compute-1 .. 2. Check hosts in the freepool: .. sourcecode:: console blazar host-list .. Result:: +----+---------------------+-------+-----------+----------+ | id | hypervisor_hostname | vcpus | memory_mb | local_gb | +----+---------------------+-------+-----------+----------+ | 1 | compute-1 | 2 | 3951 | 38 | +----+---------------------+-------+-----------+----------+ 2. Create a lease ----------------- 1. Create a lease (instance reservation) using lease-create command: .. sourcecode:: console blazar lease-create --reservation vcpus=1,memory_mb=1024,disk_gb=20,amount=2,affinity=False --start-date "2017-06-08 12:00" --end-date "2017-06-09 12:00" lease-1 .. Result:: 2. Check leases: .. sourcecode:: console blazar lease-list .. Result:: 3. Use the leased resources --------------------------- While the reservation you created is active you can see and use the flavor of your reservation. .. sourcecode:: condole openstack flavor list .. Result:: 1. Create a server: Please specify the flavor of the reservaiton and group_id as a scheduler hint. .. sourcecode:: console openstack server create --flavor --image <image> --network <network> --hint group= <server-name> ..

commit_message:
Add ceph_client role

The role 'ceph_client' was not found in openstack-ansible-os_tempest,
so add it.

Closes-Bug: #1704294

commit_message:
doc: Rewrap 'code-review' at ¬79 characters

Change-Id: I37146d4890e796e92be7801b329a45d80a4c1668
TrivialFix
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/60/384960/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This is a very terse set of points for reviewers to consider when looking at nova code. These are things that are important for the continued smooth operation of Nova, but that tend to be carried as "tribal knowledge" instead of being written down. It is an attempt to boil down some of those things into nearly checklist format. Further explanation about why some of these things are important belongs elsewhere and should be linked from here. * The manager-side method needs to tolerate older calls as well as newer calls * Arguments can be added as long as they are optional. Arguments cannot be removed or changed in an incompatible way. * The RPC client code (example: compute/rpcapi.py) needs to be able to honor a pin for the older version (see self.client.can_send_version() calls). If we are pinned at 1.5, but the version requirement for a method is 1.7, we need to be able to formulate the call at version 1.5. * Methods can drop compatibility with older versions when we bump a major version. compute/rpcapi.py) implementation. However, the manager method must continue to exist until the major version of the API is bumped.* If a tracked attribute (i.e. listed in fields) or remotable method is added, or a method is changed, the object version must be bumped. Changes for methods follow the same rules as above for regular RPC methods. We have tests to try to catch these changes, which remind you to bump the version and then correct the version-hash in the tests. * Field types cannot be changed. If absolutely required, create a new attribute and deprecate the old one. Ideally, support converting the old attribute to the new one with an obj_load_attr() handler. There are some exceptional cases where changing the type can be allowed, but care must be taken to ensure it does not affect the wireline API. * New attributes should be removed from the primitive in obj_make_compatible() if the attribute was added after the target version. * Remotable methods should not return unversioned structures wherever possible. They should return objects or simple values as the return types are not (and cannot) be checked by the hash tests. * Remotable methods should not take complex structures as arguments. These cannot be verified by the hash tests, and thus are subject to drift. Either construct an object and pass that, or pass all the simple values required to make the call. * Changes to an object as described above will cause a hash to change in TestObjectVersions. This is a reminder to the developer and the reviewer that the version needs to be bumped. There are times when we need to make a change to an object without bumping its version, but those cases are only where the hash logic detects a change that is not actually a compatibility issue and must be handled carefully.* Changes to the database schema must generally be additive-only. This means you can add columns, but you can't drop or alter a column. We have some hacky tests to try to catch these things, but they are fragile. Extreme reviewer attention to non-online alterations to the DB schema will help us avoid disaster. * Dropping things from the schema is a thing we need to be extremely careful about, making sure that the column has not been used (even present in one of our models) for at least a release. * Data migrations must not be present in schema migrations. If data needs to be converted to another format, or moved from one place to another, then that must be done while the database server remains online. Generally, this can and should be hidden within the object layer so that an object can load from either the old or new location, and save to the new one.When making a change to the nova API, we should always follow `the API WG guidelines <https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/>`_ rather than going for "local" consistency. Developers and reviewers should read all of the guidelines, but they are very long. So here are some key points: * ``project`` should be used in the REST API instead of ``tenant``. * ``server`` should be used in the REST API instead of ``instance``. * ``compute`` should be used in the REST API instead of ``nova``. * URL should not include underscores; use hyphens ('-') instead. * The field names contained in a request/response body should use snake_case style, not CamelCase or Mixed_Case style. * Synchronous resource creation: ``201 Created`` * Asynchronous resource creation: ``202 Accepted`` * Synchronous resource deletion: ``204 No Content`` * For all other successful operations: ``200 OK``grouping. For example, all of the options that affect the scheduler would be in the ``scheduler.py`` file, and all the networking options would be moved to ``network.py``.* A short description which explains what it does. If it is a unit (e.g. timeouts or so) describe the unit which is used (seconds, megabyte, mebibyte, ...). * If this is an option with numeric values (int, float), describe the edge cases (like the min value, max value, 0, -1). Any change that is not tested well by the Jenkins check jobs must have a recent +1 vote from an appropriate third party test (or tests) on the latest patchset, before a core reviewer is allowed to make a +2 vote.At a minimum, we must ensure that any technology specific code has a +1 from the relevant third party test, on the latest patchset, before a +2 vote can be applied. Specifically, changes to ``nova/virt/driver/<NNNN>`` need a +1 vote from the respective third party CI. For example, if you change something in the XenAPI virt driver, you must wait for a +1 from the XenServer CI on the latest patchset, before you can give that patch set a +2 vote. vote on, can be blocked from merging by that third party CI. But we need a lot more work to make something like that feasible, hence the proposed compromise. outside the virt drivers, this policy is not focusing on fixing that. A third party test failure should always be investigated, but the failure of a third party test to report in a timely manner should not block others. * We are only talking about the testing of in-tree code. The only public API is our REST API, see: :doc:`policies`* A new patch for the microversion API change in python-novaclient side should be submitted. passing; it does not need to be merged yet as long as it is testing the Nova change via Depends-On. The Nova microversion change commit message should reference the Change-Id of the Tempest test for reviewers to identify it. Notifications ============= * Every new notification type shall use the new versioned notification infrastructure documented in :doc:`notifications`Refer to the `reno documentation <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/usage.html#editing-a-release-note>`_ * The patch has an `UpgradeImpact <http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#peer-review>`_ tag * A DB change needs some deployer modification (like a migration) * A configuration option change (deprecation, removal or modified default) * Some specific changes that have a `DocImpact <http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#peer-review>`_ tag but require further action from an deployer perspective * Any patch that requires an action from the deployer in general * If the patch fixes a known vulnerability * If the patch has an `APIImpact <http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#peer-review>`_ tag * For nova-manage and python-novaclient changes, if it adds or changes a new command, including adding new options to existing commands * Not all blueprints in general, just the ones impacting a `contractual API <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/policies.html#public-contractual-apis>`_ * A new virt driver is provided or an existing driver impacts the `HypervisorSupportMatrix <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/support-matrix.html>`_ * Bugfixes categorized as Critical in Launchpad *impacting users* * No clear definition of such bugfixes. Hairy long-standing bugs with high importance that have been fixed are good candidates though. Three sections are left intentionally unexplained: ``prelude``, ``issues`` and ``other``. Those are targeted to be filled in close to the release time for

subject: Create publish-openstack-tarball job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-03 15:59:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/a2351c63b64b8cd862e3f1895cc12cb9b4fabbae', 'message': 'WIP: Create openstack-python-tarball job

Change-Id: Ia79802dd386dbf1287af16a59985ce99a7dd4899
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-04 19:53:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/308ff207b2356a57f329e5d408d5f6d2839300cb', 'message': 'Create openstack-python-tarball job

This created a trusted job for the purpose of publishing python job

commit_message:
Create publish-openstack-tarball job

This created a trusted job for the purpose of publishing
artifacts to tarballs.o.o.

Change-Id: Ia79802dd386dbf1287af16a59985ce99a7dd4899
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/76/490576/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - hosts: all tasks: - name: Find tarballs and wheels in dist folder. find: file_type: file paths: "src/{{ zuul.project.canonical_name }}/dist" patterns: "*.tar.gz,*.whl" register: result - name: Display stat for tarballs and wheels. stat: path: "{{ item.path }}" with_items: "{{ result.files }}" - name: Collect tarball artifacts. synchronize: dest: "{{ zuul.executor.work_root }}/artifacts" mode: pull src: "{{ item.path }}" verify_host: true with_items: "{{ result.files }}"

I cannot bump the api version to 1.5 as the unit test fail. seem

lead to unit test fail.

commit_message:
Fix get_highest_client_server_version with Cinder API + uWSGI

get_highest_client_server_version should work with any endpoint type:
cinder-api with eventlet, uWSGI, etc.

This patch is based on python-novaclient patch [1]. In a future, we can
deprecate get_highest_client_server_version in flavor of keystoneauth
descovery feature.

[1] Icba858b496855e2ffd71b35168e8057b28236119

Closes-Bug: #1708188
Change-Id: I9acf6dc84c32b25bfe3254eb0f97248736498d32

commit_message:
Add a guide for Devstack configuration for boot-from-volume

This patch adds a guide for Devstack configuration to build a
environment to test boot-from-volume feature with VMs.

Change-Id: If1a2f1a712af61618ec6e96ce3bad67295ddcff3
Partial-Bug: #1559691
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/68/466568/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ===================================== Ironic Boot-from-Volume with DevStack ===================================== This guide shows how to setup DevStack for enabling boot-from-volume feature. Using VMs as baremetal servers ============================== This scenario shows how to setup Devstack to enable nodes to boot from volumes managed by Cinder with VMs as baremetal servers. DevStack Configuration ---------------------- The following is ``local.conf`` that will setup Devstack with 3 VMs that are registered in ironic. A volume connector with IQN is created for each node. These connectors can be used to connect volumes created by Cinder with default configuration. :: [[local|localrc]] # Check out patches being developed for python-ironicclient # We should used the latest revison. # TODO(hshiina): This should be deleted after the patches are merged. LIBS_FROM_GIT=python-ironicclient IRONICCLIENT_BRANCH=refs/changes/38/427738/7 # Check out a patch being developed for Nova # TODO(hshiina): This should be deleted after the patch is merged. NOVA_BRANCH=refs/changes/85/215385/12 # Enable Ironic plugin # TODO(hshiina): The branch argument should be deleted after the patches are merged. enable_plugin ironic git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/33/466333/1 IRONIC_ENABLED_STORAGE_INTERFACES=cinder IRONIC_STORAGE_INTERFACE=cinder # Credentials ADMIN_PASSWORD=password DATABASE_PASSWORD=password RABBIT_PASSWORD=password SERVICE_PASSWORD=password SERVICE_TOKEN=password SWIFT_HASH=password SWIFT_TEMPURL_KEY=password # Enable Neutron which is required by Ironic and disable nova-network. disable_service n-net disable_service n-novnc enable_service q-svc enable_service q-agt enable_service q-dhcp enable_service q-l3 enable_service q-meta enable_service neutron # Enable Swift for agent_* drivers enable_service s-proxy enable_service s-object enable_service s-container enable_service s-account # Disable Horizon disable_service horizon # Disable Heat disable_service heat h-api h-api-cfn h-api-cw h-eng # Swift temp URL's are required for agent_* drivers. SWIFT_ENABLE_TEMPURLS=True # Create 3 virtual machines to pose as Ironic's baremetal nodes. IRONIC_VM_COUNT=3 IRONIC_VM_SSH_PORT=22 IRONIC_BAREMETAL_BASIC_OPS=True DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE=baremetal # Enable Ironic drivers. IRONIC_ENABLED_DRIVERS=fake,agent_ssh,agent_ipmitool,pxe_ssh,pxe_ipmitool # Change this to alter the default driver for nodes created by devstack. # This driver should be in the enabled list above. IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER=agent_ipmitool # The parameters below represent the minimum possible values to create # functional nodes. IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM=1280 IRONIC_VM_SPECS_DISK=10 # Size of the ephemeral partition in GB. Use 0 for no ephemeral partition. IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK=0 # To build your own IPA ramdisk from source, set this to True IRONIC_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK=False VIRT_DRIVER=ironic # By default, DevStack creates a 10.0.0.0/24 network for instances. # If this overlaps with the hosts network, you may adjust with the # following. NETWORK_GATEWAY=10.1.0.1 FIXED_RANGE=10.1.0.0/24 FIXED_NETWORK_SIZE=256 # Log all output to files LOGFILE=$HOME/devstack.log LOGDIR=$HOME/logs IRONIC_VM_LOG_DIR=$HOME/ironic-bm-logs

Enable DevStack to set up the new instance reservation feature

commit_message:
Enable instance_plugin to handle on_start and on_end events

The Blazar manager service calls on_start/on_end methods of the
instance_plugin class at the beginning or end of reservations. This
patch implements the two methods in instance_plugin.

The on_start method adds a flavor access right to the reserving user and
adds allocated hosts to the reserved aggregate.

The on_end method removes the access right to avoid creating new
instances with the reserved flavor first, then it deletes all instances
created by the flavor and removes hosts from the reserved aggregate.

Partially implements: blueprint new-instance-reservation

Change-Id: I885139224d8116599b2b02cab6ac1831352f8cb1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/32/481632/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ctx = context.current() instance_reservation = db_api.instance_reservation_get(resource_id) reservation_id = instance_reservation['reservation_id'] try: self.nova.flavor_access.add_tenant_access(reservation_id, ctx.project_id) except nova_exceptions.ClientException: LOG.info('Fails to associate flavor %s to project %s' % (reservation_id, ctx.project_id)) raise mgr_exceptions.EventError() pool = nova.ReservationPool() for allocation in db_api.host_allocation_get_all_by_values( reservation_id=reservation_id): host = db_api.host_get(allocation['compute_host_id']) pool.add_computehost(instance_reservation['aggregate_id'], host['service_name'], stay_in=True) instance_reservation = db_api.instance_reservation_get(resource_id) ctx = context.current() self.nova.flavor_access.remove_tenant_access( instance_reservation['reservation_id'], ctx.project_id) allocations = db_api.host_allocation_get_all_by_values( reservation_id=instance_reservation['reservation_id']) for allocation in allocations: db_api.host_allocation_destroy(allocation['id']) for server in self.nova.servers.list(search_opts={ 'flavor': instance_reservation['reservation_id'], 'all_tenant': 1}): server.delete() self.cleanup_resources(instance_reservation)

commit_message:
Use Sphinx 1.5 warning-is-error

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, the setting for treat sphinx warnings as
errors is setting warning-is-error in build_sphinx section. Migrate the
setting from the old warnerrors one.

Change-Id: I3dd597856717789db75cea19dcaa34eaf7c53c24

commit_message:
fix to avoid crash loop on ceph clean job

ceph clean job tries to delete a secret. but if there's no the secret,
the job falls in CrashLoopBackOff status when helm delete.

Change-Id: I863e43f576408fdcd24997bde9b658c50b0057c1
Closes-bug: 1708597

commit_message:
Adding zhurong candidacy for Murano

Change-Id: Ifc8c4a85f4101f6f8bb8fba9400d5272fda7c735
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/47/491147/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi, I would like to nominate myself to take the role of Murano PTL for Queens release. I’ve been working on the project for the past couple years. Working with Murano is probably the most exciting thing I do professionally. It is my pleasure to work with the great team to make this project better and better, and we will keep moving and look forward to push Murano to the next level. In past cycles, we have done a lot of great works. We got moving policy into code, allow encrypting of muranopl properties, add api ref docs, bug fixes and so on. Thanks for everyone's hard working. I’m really excited to work with Murano further, and to grow the community surrounding it. The more companies that contribute to Murano, the stronger the community around it will be, capable of maintaining and enhancing Murano for years to come. The main goals I’d like to focus on for Murano during Queens are: * Acknowledgment of OpenStack-wide Goals. * Add Murano-dashboard sanity_check CI job. * Significantly improve Murano documentation. * Murano’s integration with GLARE. * Focus on addressing a number of outstanding bugs in Murano. These include adding SIGHUP signal support to Murano, support multiple rabbit hosts in RabbitMQ for Murano Agent, and addressing other UI bugs, like abandon environment hanging issues. * Increase developer contribution in Murano through my own coding efforts, as well as through ZTE’s resources. Thanks for taking the time to read through this roadmap and to consider my candidacy. Regardless of the outcome, I'm excited to continue contributing to Murano, be it code or code reviews. Regards, Rong Zhu

subject: Adding Saad Zaher (szaher) candidacy for Freezer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-06 01:06:50.000000000', 'files': ['candidates/queens/Freezer/szaher.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/election/commit/776dea0d64ccf2622282b32e11ee201b61fd240f', 'message': 'Adding Saad Zaher (szaher) candidacy for Freezer

Change-Id: I2b9cda69357a4a4946240098ad1113ea7935b8be
'}]
commit_message:
Adding Saad Zaher (szaher) candidacy for Freezer

Change-Id: I2b9cda69357a4a4946240098ad1113ea7935b8be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/06/491206/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi All, I'm happy to announce my candidacy to be the Freezer PTL for the Queens release cycle. The Freezer developers did a very good job over the past releases and I am sure they will continue doing an amazing job over the next release as well. In the Pike release, we have implemented more than one engine for OpenStack like (nova, cinder, cinder_OSbrick, rsync...) In the Queens release we need to set more focus on enhancing these engines and make it work better and add more features to these engines. Also for the Queens cycle we need to add more features to freezer-dr to support more use cases of the disaster recovery scenarios, In Pike we have change a little bit to allow the addition of more features in the new relases. In the Queens cycle, I think we are going to focus on the following items: * Enhancing core freezer-agent features and continue refactoring the missing parts to allow pluggable architecture to support more engines and applications in freezer. Some refactoring has already been done, also some new engines and storage driver has been added, so we need to keep those engines/drivers well maintained, enhanced and up to date! * Completed the move from Elasticsearch to Oslo.db * Relate the backups, jobs, sessions, resources to tenants not to users. * Integration tests. We need to increase the work done on testing. This will help to stabilize Freezer. * Documentation. We should target for a split, refactoring and global improvement of our docs, which is a required step to increase the size of our community. * Implement remote backups. Allow the users to use any instance of freezer-agent to backup remote resources to any storage driver * Deprecate CLI. Freezer-agent will accept jobs only through configuration files not through CLI. * Allow the engines/storage drivers to register their own OPTS I would be honoured to have your support. Thanks, Saad Zaher (szaher)

subject: Adding Lance Bragstad's candidacy for keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 20:38:57.000000000', 'files': ['candidates/queens/Keystone/lbragstad.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/election/commit/d7c037b7c008c1995fbbca9d2430a8b790d97b13', 'message': "Adding Lance Bragstad's candidacy for keystone

Change-Id: I9769a314e6d2e1af2a6cc96abe906556edd72684
"}]
commit_message:
Adding Lance Bragstad's candidacy for keystone

Change-Id: I9769a314e6d2e1af2a6cc96abe906556edd72684
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/86/491086/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi all, I'd like to formally communicate my desire to continue serving as the keystone PTL for the upcoming Queen’s release. Despite some turbulence throughout the Pike development cycle, keystone has managed to make progress on some long standing issues. Even though the pace of development has decreased, I think we can build momentum from the small victories in Pike and have a productive Queens release. I'd like to direct our focus on the following areas for continued improvement and stability of the keystone project throughout the Queen’s cycle. *Policy Improvements* We dedicated a significant portion of our time this release getting policy into code and documented. We also had meaningful discussions with operators and developers, resulting in a plan that improves long-standing issues with OpenStack policy enforcement. I'd like to carry this momentum into Queens and ensure we’re implementing global role assignments. Additionally, I'd like to work closely with the oslo team to find ways we can signal deprecations to operators though the oslo.policy library. This will help us define a better set of default roles in Rocky, and clean-up policy enforcement at each service. Lastly, I look forward to championing the community goal to move policy and documentation into code for all applicable projects. *Application Credentials* At the forum and while reviewing the specification, we realized just how important this work is to our users. While it's unfortunate we didn't make as much progress here as we hoped during Pike, the discussions this cycle highlighted a lot of concerns with design as well as usability. I think we're all better off and more prepared to address the last few tough design bits during the PTG. One of my goals during the PTG is to facilitate those conversations and verbosely communicate our approach. I think that will help us keep the goal in mind as we drive towards delivering this in Queens. *Unified Limits* Addressing unified limits was another long-standing issue that we did a good job of capturing and documenting throughout the Pike release [0]. Pending available resources, it would be great to push this forward, starting with unified limits in keystone. This will have a positive impact on any project currently experiencing issues with quota and will make quota usability more consistent overall. *Testing* Throughout Pike, our team spent a significant amount of time paying down testing, technical debt. We cleaned-up and extended support for federated testing, and we've integrated testing with our tempest plugin. We added experimental support to test rolling upgrades and look forward to gating on rolling upgrades in Queens. In the upcoming months, we need to focus our efforts on better LDAP integration testing, which has been on our TODO list for too long. *Team Building* Last, but certainly not least, we need to recruit new keystone contributors - part or full-time. Some of our most experienced and well-versed developers moved onto other projects outside of OpenStack. Luckily, the remaining team members have ambitiously stepped up to fill the gaps. I want to ensure this project is working optimally on all cylinders. In order for us to do this and achieve our Queen’s goals, we need more contributors. Thanks for reading and I look forward to seeing everyone in Denver, Lance [0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/ongoing/unified-limits.html

subject: mordred Queens shade PTL candidacy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-07 14:22:30.000000000', 'files': ['candidates/queens/Shade/mordred.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/election/commit/2af2687f35cdc067032f436db717f3d235174a02', 'message': 'mordred Queens shade PTL candidacy

Change-Id: I1bacc2a5ea98a2027ce2faa93ce072a466c8aaaf
'}]
commit_message:
mordred Queens shade PTL candidacy

Change-Id: I1bacc2a5ea98a2027ce2faa93ce072a466c8aaaf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/03/491503/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: I would like to be the PTL of the shade project for another cycle. Over the past few years the shade project has grown from a utility library containing some logic needed by the Infrastructure team and Ansible for interacting with OpenStack clouds to a rich SDK that serves the general needs of humans who want to use OpenStack. This past cycle we (mostly) accomplished two main goals that were not exciting features but which are immensely important nonetheless. We ported our unittests to use requests-mock instead of mocking out individual python client libraries, and we replaced our use of the python client libraries with direct REST calls based on keystoneauth. This was rather mind-numbing and I fear we may have eaten the brains of a few wonderful contributors - but it means that our dependency chain is much slimmer so inclusion in distros and alongside apps should be less costly. We still need to finish converting the last keystoneclient calls and to transition the Ironic calls. TheJulia did WAY too good of a job writing tests when implemeting Ironic support originally, so it may take a little while to finish that one. Over the next cycle we need to update our REST layer to incorporate the recent changes made in keystoneauth related to service and version discovery. This largely means removing code, which is always pleasant. Once that's done we'll be in a position to start using microversions as appropriate. Glance has landed experimental support for the new Image upload process, and we need to add detection and implementation of that to our Image upload system so that we'll use it when it's available. There is some very important work we need to do deep in the guts related to caching and batching of calls. We have a system for this that is designed to ensure that large-scale systems such as Nodepool can operate effectively, but it's proving costly for smaller users and needs to be optimized. I recently suggested merging the work of the python-openstacksdk team into shade. If we decide as a larger OpenStack community that this is a direction we want to go, we'll need to do a decent amount of plumbing to ensure that's as smooth as possible for both sets of users. Finally, I think if we don't make some forward progress on the oaktree gRPC federation API that samueldmq will be very unhappy with me. We've been explicitly putting off working on that to ensure we get the RESTification work done. This next cycle I expect to make real progress on that so that we can at least have a proof point to look at so we can discuss a real thing rather than a theory. I'm proud of what we've done so far, and I think there is a ton we can continue to do to serve OpenStack End Users well. Thank you for your consideration, Monty

commit_message:
fix to avoid crash loop on glance clean job

glance clean job tries to delete a image. but if there's no the image,
the job falls in CrashLoopBackOff status when helm delete.

Change-Id: I3b9c3057b9da8780ca27f1cb18dcd5541f3bcabc
Closes-bug: 1708581

commit_message:
Remove custom handling of OvsPorts in controller

Remove the callbacks for OVS ports, and use the default update/delete
code. This adds caching of the above objects, and notifications to apps
only when they change.

Change-Id: Ibab8195f036cfcb8f8389e7cc944d5f8ad6ff116

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/82/490782/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: I announce my candidacy for the PTL of the Packaging RPM project. I have been a contributor to various OpenStack projects since Havana and I'm one of the initial cores of the packaging RPM project. The project goal is to produce a production-ready set of OpenStack packages for RPM-based systems (like SLES, RHEL, openSUSE, Fedora, etc.). As a PTL, I would focus on: - python3 support. The currently available packages are python2 only. Distros are moving to python3 as default so providing python3 packages (starting with the libs and clients) should be done now. - getting more services packaged. We currently have most of the libs and clients available but there are a lot of services still missing. - Improve tooling. There are still things that can be automated when new packages are created or available ones updated. Thanks, Tom irc: toabctl

commit_message:
moves to networking_hyperv namespace

This project should use the networking_hyperv namespace, in order
to be consistent with the other networking-* projects, as well as
avoiding namespace sharing with compute-hyperv.

Closes-Bug: #1709085

Change-Id: Ib268aea951714ed4b8c510cb3d2744b4d9f39ce6

commit_message:
Create Nova resources for instance reservations

The instance reservation feature needs to handle Nova resources
(flavors, aggregates, and server groups) for scheduling. This patch
enables instance_plugin to create these resources when the create_lease
API is called.

Partially implements: blueprint new-instance-reservation
Change-Id: Ic69ebf613668d15b566a59702100ad8abfba8a6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/29/480929/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from novaclient import exceptions as nova_exceptionsfrom blazar import contextfrom blazar.utils.openstack import novaRESERVATION_PREFIX = 'reservation' FLAVOR_EXTRA_SPEC = "aggregate_instance_extra_specs:" + RESERVATION_PREFIX class VirtualInstancePlugin(base.BasePlugin, nova.NovaClientWrapper): super(VirtualInstancePlugin, self).__init__( username=CONF.os_admin_username, password=CONF.os_admin_password, user_domain_name=CONF.os_admin_user_domain_name, project_name=CONF.os_admin_project_name, project_domain_name=CONF.os_admin_user_domain_name) def _create_resources(self, instance_reservation): reservation_id = instance_reservation['reservation_id'] ctx = context.current() user_client = nova.NovaClientWrapper(auth_token=ctx.auth_token) reserved_group = user_client.server_groups.create( 'reservation:' + reservation_id, 'affinity' if instance_reservation['affinity'] else 'anti-affinity' ) flavor_details = { 'name': reservation_id, 'vcpus': instance_reservation['vcpus'], 'ram': instance_reservation['memory_mb'], 'disk': instance_reservation['disk_gb'], 'is_public': False } reserved_flavor = self.nova.flavors.create(**flavor_details) extra_specs = { FLAVOR_EXTRA_SPEC: reservation_id, "affinity_id": reserved_group.id } reserved_flavor.set_keys(extra_specs) pool = nova.ReservationPool() pool_metadata = { RESERVATION_PREFIX: reservation_id, 'filter_tenant_id': ctx.project_id } pool.create(name=reservation_id, metadata=pool_metadata) return reserved_flavor, reserved_group, pool def cleanup_resources(self, instance_reservation): def check_and_delete_resource(client, id): if client.get(id): client.delete(id) reservation_id = instance_reservation['reservation_id'] check_and_delete_resource(self.nova.server_groups, reservation_id) check_and_delete_resource(self.nova.flavors, reservation_id) check_and_delete_resource(nova.ReservationPool(), reservation_id) try: flavor, group, pool = self._create_resources(instance_reservation) except nova_exceptions.ClientException: LOG.exception("Fails to create Nova's resources " "for reservation %s" % reservation_id) self.cleanup_resources(instance_reservation) db_api.instance_reservation_update(instance_reservation['id'], {'flavor_id': flavor.id, 'server_group_id': group.id, 'aggregate_id': pool.id})

commit_message:
Send haproxy stat command as bytes

The get_stats method on the haproxy driver fails with a byte error,
let's encode the command before sending it, and decode the result.

Change-Id: I3ea1ca4ca3216e9411ac761f54f458eea5d736fb
Closes-Bug: #1698301

commit_message:
Remove ovsdb.objects

OvsdbVirtuaTunnelPort was used to describe OVS tunnel ports, we have
OvsPort model exactly for that, so we can get rid of the class

Partially-Implements: bp refactor-nb-api
Change-Id: Ieb00e819cf5af0d1e7693a160de99258956d74c7

commit_message:
Amend spec for "Allow custom resource classes in flavor extra specs"

There are a few changes here:

1. Use real footnotes.

2. Provide an example of the issue described in the data model impact
   section.

3. Change owners since Jim is no longer working on this.

4. Update the data model impact and dependency sections since there was
   a gap here in that blueprint custom-resource-classes-pike only
   reported resource class inventory to placement for the Ironic driver,
   it did not do anything about reporting allocations for custom resource
   classes. That is folded into this spec.

Spec for blueprint custom-resource-classes-in-flavors

Change-Id: If8072d04369b643a29f68f89035eef594b3bcc7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/48/481748/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: classes [1]_ spec.While this does have the benefit of avoiding an off chance that some operatorFor example, let's say an existing ironic instance has a resource_class of ``CUSTOM_BAREMETAL_GOLD`` which is consumed in the baremetal service but is not reported as a resource provider allocation in the placement service. If an operator configures a flavor's extra_specs and sets ``resources:CUSTOM_BAREMETAL_GOLD=1``, the scheduler may pick a node to host build instance but the resource is actually already consumed and would result in a build failure. To resolve this, we need to do two things: 1. We'll need to check each existing instance at Pike startup, in the driver layer. If the ironic node that the instance exists on has a resource class defined, we add the custom resource class to ``instance.flavor``. 2. When updating instance allocations in the ``update_available_resource`` periodic task in the nova-compute service, the scheduler report client will need to check for custom resource classes on the ``instance.flavor`` and report those into the placement service... warning:: Deployers should not adjust their flavors until the data migration described in the `Data model impact`_ section above is complete. Ed Leafe (edleafe) Jay Pipes (jaypipes)* Add code to report custom resource class allocations. * Add overrides for standard resource classes (the deployer does this).This change depends on the resource tracker reporting custom resource class inventory, which is tracked in the "Custom Resource Classes (Pike)" blueprint. [2]_.. [1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ocata/approved/custom-resource-classes.html .. [2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/custom-resource-classes-pike
deleted_lines: classes[0] spec.While this does have the benefit of avoiding an oft chance that some operatorWe'll need to check each existing instance at Pike startup, in the driver layer. commit_message:
Fix Deployment Guide for kolla-kubernetes

In this doc :
https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-kubernetes/latest/deployment-guide.html

after step of deploy Kubernetes with kubeadm, the note is :

If the following issue occurs after running this command:

preflight] Some fatal errors occurred:
/proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-iptables contents are not set to 1

There are two work-arounds:
Add net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables = 1 and
net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables = 1 to /etc/sysctl.conf

Type sysctl -p to apply the settings from /etc/sysctl.conf
Type sysctl net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip[6]tables to
verify the values are set to 1.
-------------------------------------

Modify preflight] to [preflight].

Modify command 'sysctl net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip[6]tables' to
'sysctl net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables' and
'sysctl net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables'

Change-Id: Ib19ea6e6893967e99cd7f6f1b8c0b83a0f8088b5
Close-bug: #1707149

commit_message:
This adds a variable to add stack user to the undercloud image

The rhel stock image does not seem to have stack user by
default and it fails to go past the inject instackenv.json
stage on the undercloud libvirt setup. To aide the stock rhel
image to pass this stage, adding the task to create the stack
user.

Change-Id: I0b4ed6b4e3fa137be08d1c116ed42c914e5aeb82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/07/490407/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: virt-customize -v -x -a {{ working_dir }}/undercloud.qcow2 # For Images which have no stack user, the next steps are going to fail. # For such images, please enable the flag # libvirt_undercloud_create_stack_user = True - name: Inject stack user command: > virt-customize -v -a {{ working_dir }}/undercloud.qcow2 --run-command 'useradd stack; echo "stack ALL=(root) NOPASSWD:ALL" | tee -a /etc/sudoers.d/stack; chmod 0440 /etc/sudoers.d/stack' when: libvirt_undercloud_create_stack_user|bool virt-customize -v -x -a {{ working_dir }}/undercloud.qcow2

commit_message:
Check maximum usages of hosts in a particular time window

Instance reservation needs to check maximum usages of hypervisors in a
particular time window since multi-instances reservations share one
hypervisor at the same time.

This patch enables the instance reservation plugin to calculate
maximum usages of vcpus, memory_mb, and disk_gb for a hypervisor.

Partially implements: blueprint new-instance-reservation
Change-Id: I78be0aa3fdccc110f5f67dfc7315c8d9c4cc5e1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/50/478450/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def resource_usage_by_event(event, resource_type): return event[1][resource_type] events_list = [] for r in reservations: fetched_events = db_api.event_get_all_sorted_by_filters( sort_key='time', sort_dir='asc', filters={'lease_id': r['lease_id']}) events_list.extend([[e, r] for e in fetched_events]) events_list.sort(key=lambda x: x[0]['time']) max_vcpus = max_memory = max_disk = 0 current_vcpus = current_memory = current_disk = 0 for event in events_list: if event[0]['event_type'] == 'start_lease': current_vcpus += resource_usage_by_event(event, 'vcpus') current_memory += resource_usage_by_event(event, 'memory_mb') current_disk += resource_usage_by_event(event, 'disk_gb') if max_vcpus < current_vcpus: max_vcpus = current_vcpus if max_memory < current_memory: max_memory = current_memory if max_disk < current_disk: max_disk = current_disk elif event[0]['event_type'] == 'end_lease': current_vcpus -= resource_usage_by_event(event, 'vcpus') current_memory -= resource_usage_by_event(event, 'memory_mb') current_disk -= resource_usage_by_event(event, 'disk_gb') return max_vcpus, max_memory, max_disk
deleted_lines: # TODO(masahito): needs to check the max usage of the host in the # time window return 0, 0, 0

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary assertIsNotNone check

This is to remove the unnecessary assertIsNotNone checks
if there is already not-null check in schema, like
"'id': {'type': 'string'}".

Change-Id: I26b085cbd060ed11c4dc594744f87463a2dc52eb

commit_message:
Add instance reservation plugin

This patch adds a new instance plugin. It is a first cut for the plugin.
Currently, the plugin only creates reservations but doesn't handle
starting and ending reservations.

Partially implements: blueprint new-instance-reservation
Change-Id: I60d93829bd05f0be48ba07b01f76a1f6bf190cf8

subject: FC: cleanup WWN usage

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-03 10:39:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-win/commit/d7d11ca086ddc91565abaff6c7df91343d131ed5', 'message': "FC: cleanup WWN usage

At the moment, we're using WWNs represented either as byte arrays,
hex strings or ctypes structures. Needless to say, this is quite
confusing as the fc_utils methods accept multiple formats.

As per this change, we're accepting WWNs represented as hex strings
in case of the public methods (just as before), while for private
methods we're using ctypes WWN structures (containing 8 byte arrays),
which in turn are passed to hbaapi.dll functions.

Some arguments are renamed/documented accordingly. Note that the
helper methods converting those WWNs are moved to the '_utils'
module, as those will be reused by a subsequent change.

commit_message:
FC: cleanup WWN usage

At the moment, we're using WWNs represented either as byte arrays,
hex strings or ctypes structures. Needless to say, this is quite
confusing as the fc_utils methods accept multiple formats.

As per this change, we're accepting WWNs represented as hex strings
in case of the public methods (just as before), while for private
methods we're using ctypes WWN structures (containing 8 byte arrays),
which in turn are passed to hbaapi.dll functions.

Some arguments are renamed/documented accordingly. Note that the
helper methods converting those WWNs are moved to the '_utils'
module, as those will be reused by a subsequent change.

Change-Id: I43daf4ad943d0097c951c2ad4ccb856a2fe9e1bc

commit_message:
Change job type for 3nodes job to move to oooq runner

For the new style of tripleo-ci job, we key off the job type in
order to use the correct configuration for the job. This change
will move the 3nodes job to the new style.

This also changes the 3nodes job to run on tripleo-ci and
tripleo-quickstart(-extras) changes. This is essential to make
sure we are checking changes that could break this job.

Change-Id: I429a719b49dce85aa95b4b34040f7646786a54fa

commit_message:
iSCSI: add checks for MPIO disks

This change adds an extra parameter to the method which ensures
that a lun is available. This allows verifying that the according
disk was claimed by the MPIO service.

Note that for convenience reasons, the 'ensure_lun_available'
method arguments are now exposed by the 'get_device_number_and_path'
method.

Change-Id: If5f00a019be76c09724f4e93f3d53431286d0efa
Related-Bug: #1694671

commit_message:
[Trivial] Add method checking if a disk is claimed by MPIO

This change adds a new method that will determine if a disk was
already claimed by the MPIO service.

In some situations, a disk number may change after being claimed by
the MPIO service. This method will allow discovering multipath disks
properly.

Change-Id: I0b3f7d81aa79f07efc430e563ebdfa6c7aceb7b2
Partial-Bug: #1694671

propose it to the ML, then finally approve it.

of the os-vif object model.

commit_message:
[Trusts] Fix deleting trust

 * Delete trust only after the last execution of
   cron-trigger or event-trigger is completed.
   Otherwise during workflow execution we get
   an error "Unauthorized error: No such trust <id>"

Closes-Bug: #1708139

Change-Id: I42849d4f7c517f8a27e0d26c9cf0d98f9c7fb94a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/49/490049/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

fix running tempest tests

* virtualenv is not working so installing vitrage again makes a mess
this fix was done in ocata

commit_message:
Add release notes for client registration changes

In patch I902cfdea0af371dfa222a9bbf41edc4ea2765926 I forgot
to add the release notes file, so adding it now as a separate patch.

Change-Id: I4465913fa813971a95ca55fbda6c60312610ac64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/66/490566/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | When registering service clients from installed plugins, all registrations are now processed, even if one or more fails. All exceptions encountered during the registration process are recorded. If at least one exception was encountered, the registration process fails and all interim errors are reported. - | The __repr__ method is now implemented for the base `tempest.Exception` class, its implementation is identical to __str__: it reports the error message merged with input parameters.

commit_message:
Fix updating Qos policy to be default/not default

During QoS policy update there was no project_id
attribute loaded to QoS object. That caused problem with
updating policy object because "get_default()" method
requires project_id.
This patch fixes it by first getting QoS policy object and
then update it.

Additionally there was mistake in assertion in QoS Default
policy fullstack test and this patch fixes it also.

Conflicts:
	neutron/services/qos/qos_plugin.py
	neutron/tests/fullstack/test_qos.py
	neutron/tests/unit/services/qos/test_qos_plugin.py

Change-Id: I57011bd4d40479855203061554090d19bb668960
Closes-Bug: 1694553
(cherry picked from commit 09c946910f3ab2646a3fa3e7d1d3bfadbd1428d0)
(cherry picked from commit 571affaab09196c20ed0171d0b88481040afb2ce)

added_lines: next_update = self._queue.get(block=True) LOG.debug("Event update: %s", next_update) try: if next_update.table is not None: self.process_db_change(next_update) else: self.process_db_event(next_update.action, next_update.value) self.process_db_event('sync') def process_db_change(self, change): model_class = mf.get_model(change.table) if change.action == 'delete': self.controller.delete_by_id(model_class, change.key) else: obj = model_class.from_json(change.value) self.controller.update(obj) def process_db_event(self, action, value=None): # determine if the action is allowed or not elif action == 'sync_finished': self.controller.ovs_sync_finished() elif action == 'sync_started': self.controller.ovs_sync_started() # elif 'lport_migration' == table: # if action == 'migrate': # lport = db_models.LogicalPort(value) # self.controller.update_migrating_flows(lport) elif 'log' == action: LOG.info('Log event (Info) action: %(action)s value: %(value)s', {
deleted_lines: self.next_update = self._queue.get(block=True) LOG.debug("Event update: %s", self.next_update) try: value = self.next_update.value if (not value and self.next_update.action not in {'delete', 'log', 'dbrestart'}): if self.next_update.table and self.next_update.key: value = self.driver.get_key(self.next_update.table, self.next_update.key) self.apply_db_change(self.next_update.table, self.next_update.key, self.next_update.action, value) self.apply_db_change(None, None, 'sync', None) def apply_db_change(self, table, key, action, value): # determine if the action is allowed or not if action not in DB_ACTION_LIST: LOG.warning('Unknown action %(action)s for table ' '%(table)s', {'action': action, 'table': table}) return try: model_class = mf.get_model(table) except KeyError: # Model class not found, possibly update was not about a model pass else: if action == 'delete': self.controller.delete_by_id(model_class, key) else: obj = model_class.from_json(value) self.controller.update(obj) return if 'ovsinterface' == table: if action == 'sync_finished': self.controller.ovs_sync_finished() elif action == 'sync_started': self.controller.ovs_sync_started() elif 'lport_migration' == table: if action == 'migrate': lport = db_models.LogicalPort(value) self.controller.update_migrating_flows(lport) elif 'log' == action: message = ('Log event (Info): table: %(table)s key: %(key)s ' 'action: %(action)s value: %(value)s') LOG.info(message, { 'table': str(table), 'key': str(key), else: LOG.warning('Unknown table %s', table)

commit_message:
Skip NbApi when updating OvsPorts

OvsPorts are controller internal, are not relevant north-bound (nor they
are stored in north-bound database).

Change-Id: I6a4e5d9ebab1b70a167914e0e5b60ea82b349aa9

commit_message:
Make parameter optional in NbApi.get_instance

In some cases, where we know that NbApi was already constructed, we want
an instance of NbApi without finding out if we're running as Neutron
server or passing an arbitrary value. This is especially useful for code
common to server and controller where we lack the context to find out
our role.

Change-Id: I052c6479ceb59b436d172c43966a6fbd72022333
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/09/423809/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_instance(is_neutron_server=None): """This function returns an instance of NbApi (or constructs one on first call). The parameter is used only for initial construction of the object, so after it was created it can be ommited. """ if is_neutron_server is None: raise RuntimeError( _LE('NbApi was not initialized yet, cannot get instance'), )

commit_message:
Replace six.itervalues() with dict.values() in kuryr-kubernetes

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.itervalues
  to achieve iterators. We can use dict.values instead, as it
  will return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.values will
  more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
  see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I0f1fab85a7454515c1718594bf2c2aaa958d489b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/93/490793/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return list(set(net.id for net in subnets.values))
deleted_lines: return list(set(net.id for net in six.itervalues(subnets)))

Change-Id: I188c1db4512073bf36371b9022bd17716547bdbe
"}]
commit_message:
Pass only instance reservation specific columns to the reservation table

Some duplicated columns, such as 'id', are overwritten by columns with
the same name defined in the instance reservation table.

This patch prevents the instance reservation columns from overwriting
the reservation columns values in the to_dict method.

Partially implements: blueprint new-instance-reservation

Change-Id: I188c1db4512073bf36371b9022bd17716547bdbe

commit_message:
Fix compute CDM to include disabled compute node

Currently compute CDM excludes disabled compute node.
This patch set fixes compute CDM to include disabled compute node.

Change-Id: I8236bb73e0d9bb242251c2abfb59ad5693087afa
Closes-Bug: #1685787

commit_message:
Change supported vif type in Linux Bridge.

With [1], the vif_type for a Linux Bridge port is set
to 'tap', replacing 'bridge'. This definition needs to be
changed in the list of supported vif types in the pluging
driver.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/447150/

Change-Id: I715565627b2446533298b5905edbaa256bd84c92
Closes-Bug: #1694190
(cherry picked from commit 9fbd9eb3b7b01b5503997655ae5e8729442801eb)

commit_message:
only check links associated with the project type

When using www-generator.py with --check-all-links we don't want to
look for links that we do not expect to find or want to use. Limit the
URLs checked by the project type in that case.

Change-Id: I7560ec5d57d564730ebe60957153ea63f58002f8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
