commit_message:
Show domain name of users belonging to other domains in table

I have logged in "Default" domain, and there is a user belongs to
another domain "swift_test", I can see the domain name in it's
detail page, but None in table colume.
Now I changed another way to get it's domain name.

Change-Id: I122abf1fcfc05779705f7a7708a2742cde786ffb
Closes-bug: #1704074
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/18/483218/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # domain_lookup = api.keystone.domain_lookup(self.request) for u in users: domain = api.keystone.domain_get(self.request, u.domain_id) u.domain_name = domain.name
deleted_lines: domain_lookup = api.keystone.domain_lookup(self.request) for u in users: u.domain_name = domain_lookup.get(u.domain_id)

commit_message:
Remove xinetd package in containerized env

xinetd in an containerized environment is not really needed to
run rsync for Swift, thus removing the no longer needed package.

Depends-On: I08abd917eba08d1192437ddf96c71b06d099a3f8
Change-Id: I08735e0c78379a5a36187a35764a3f2eae6266b9

commit_message:
Add zaqar client install support

Change-Id: I8719facdbbc397c45cec7934ba275f3de8589093
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-zaqar refs/changes/73/490273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'zaqar::client' do shared_examples_for 'zaqar client' do it { is_expected.to contain_class('zaqar::deps') } it { is_expected.to contain_class('zaqar::params') } it 'installs zaqar client package' do is_expected.to contain_package('python-zaqarclient').with( :ensure => 'present', :name => platform_params[:client_package_name], :tag => 'openstack', ) end end on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge!(OSDefaults.get_facts()) end let :platform_params do { :client_package_name => 'python-zaqarclient' } end it_behaves_like 'zaqar client' end end end

commit_message:
Enable encryption of pacemaker traffic by default

We already are setting a pre-shared key by default for the pacemaker
cluster. This was done in order to communicate with TLS-PSK with
pacemaker-remote clusters. This key is also useful for us to enable
encrypted traffic for the regular cluster traffic, which we enable by
default with this patch.

Change-Id: I349b8bf79eeeaa4ddde1c17b7014603913f184cf

commit_message:
Remove use of oslo.messaging rpc_backend

The rpc_backend configuration option has been deprecated in
oslo.messaging. The default and notitification transport_url
option defines the messaging backend and communication
parameters. Inclusion on zmq/rabbit options caused duplicate
declaration following deprecation of rpc_backend in service
modules.

This patch:
* remove parameter from zmq options
* remove parameter from rabbitmq option
* update spec test

Change-Id: Ia981f1a847a428e0f07656d0922e195982e4e2f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-oslo refs/changes/64/489264/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add vhost access/error logs file/syslog options

Support vhosts logging to syslog.

Related-bug: #1700045

Change-Id: If60cb8e31c46e32ba6e04f53ac73a72bf989df2d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bogdando@mail.ru>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/00/489200/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*access_log_file*] # The log file name for the virtualhost. # Optional. Defaults to false. # # [*access_log_pipe*] # Specifies a pipe where Apache sends access logs for the virtualhost. # Optional. Defaults to false. # # [*access_log_syslog*] # Sends the virtualhost access log messages to syslog. # Optional. Defaults to false. # # [*access_log_format*] # The log format for the virtualhost. # Optional. Defaults to false. # # [*error_log_file*] # The error log file name for the virtualhost. # Optional. commit_message:
Fix unit test for neutron::client class

Change-Id: I23313bcdca32489f8e3f9fa12afcc41171e087bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/90/490290/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: shared_examples_for 'neutron client' do it { is_expected.to contain_class('neutron::deps') } it { is_expected.to contain_class('neutron::params') } it 'installs neutron client package' do is_expected.to contain_package('python-neutronclient').with( :ensure => 'present', :name => platform_params[:client_package], :tag => ['neutron-support-package', 'openstack'] ) on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge!(OSDefaults.get_facts()) end let :platform_params do { :client_package => 'python-neutronclient' } end it_behaves_like 'neutron client'
deleted_lines: let :test_facts do { :operatingsystem => 'default', :operatingsystemrelease => 'default' } end context 'on Debian platforms' do let :facts do @default_facts.merge(test_facts.merge({ :osfamily => 'Debian' })) it { is_expected.to contain_class('neutron::client') } context 'on RedHat platforms' do let :facts do @default_facts.merge(test_facts.merge({ :osfamily => 'RedHat', :operatingsystemrelease => '7' })) it { is_expected.to contain_class('neutron::client') }

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: Iea7306f8ab6e3253fd68007829b7e8b51afb790a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/41/432941/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertIn('policy.authorize', src, 'policy.authorize call not found in exposed ' 'method %s' % func) self.assertIn('context.to_policy_values', src, 'context.to_policy_values call not found in ' 'exposed method %s' % func)
deleted_lines: self.assertTrue('policy.authorize' in src, 'policy.authorize call not found in exposed ' 'method %s' % func) self.assertTrue('context.to_policy_values' in src, 'context.to_policy_values call not found in ' 'exposed method %s' % func)

subject: Add if_exist parameter to SetLRouterPortInLSwitchPortCommand
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-20 12:52:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/5fd38668e95320c6b662f4611684c6e0dcdebf70', 'message': 'Journaling recovery: Do not fail if some resources doesn't exist

This patch is plumbing code for journaling recovery. If some operation
in the journal fails it will be later retried and since it all happens
asynchronously it could happen that some other resources have been
deleted already.

This patch is adding some safe guards against that problem in two
different places:

1. The _get_networks_for_router_port() in OVNClient interact thru all
the subnets in that port and if some of them doesn't exist anymore
instead of failing completely we will log a warning message and skip it.

2. Just like many other commands the SetLRouterPortInLSwitchPortCommand
now contains the "if_exist" parameter.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: I093bc5982a71bd2d893a41a53194be3384b44088
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-23 12:19:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/729977bfb82e7c922033e672618eb4bbaf186d38', 'message': 'Journaling recovery: Do not fail if some resources doesn't exist

This patch is plumbing code for journaling recovery. If some operation
in the journal fails it will be later retried and since it all happens
asynchronously it could happen that some other resources have been
deleted already.

This patch is adding some safe guards against that problem in two
different places:

1. The _get_networks_for_router_port() in OVNClient interact thru all
the subnets in that port and if some of them doesn't exist anymore
instead of failing completely we will log a warning message and skip it.

2. Just like many other commands the SetLRouterPortInLSwitchPortCommand
now contains the "if_exist" parameter.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: I093bc5982a71bd2d893a41a53194be3384b44088
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-07 13:29:48.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_commands.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/ded2e5cd08e5e11b142bbddc9ad3b3d75d1a8d03', 'message': 'Add if_exist parameter to SetLRouterPortInLSwitchPortCommand

Like in other commands this patch is adding a "if_exist" parameter to
SetLRouterPortInLSwitchPortCommand. This will later be used by the
journal recovery module.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: I093bc5982a71bd2d893a41a53194be3384b44088
'}]
commit_message:
Add if_exist parameter to SetLRouterPortInLSwitchPortCommand

Like in other commands this patch is adding a "if_exist" parameter to
SetLRouterPortInLSwitchPortCommand. This will later be used by the
journal recovery module.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: I093bc5982a71bd2d893a41a53194be3384b44088
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/77/475777/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, api, lswitch_port, lrouter_port, if_exists): self.if_exists = if_exists if self.if_exists: return

commit_message:
Update the documentation link for doc migration

This commit updates links affected by doc migration.
Note that other links are not touched in this commit.
Fixing other broken links or changing http to https
should be covered by a separate patch.

Also convert http links to docs.openstack.org to https per reviewer
request (though it is not directly related to doc-migration).

Note that this commit does not touch files under releasenotes/notes/.
If we touch release notes in older releases, reno will considers
it as a release note in the current release.
(Pike release notes are clean up in a separate patch.)

Change-Id: Iba9bd465ef08014a4972584cf4da6e7d77961119

commit_message:
use qos constants from neutron-lib

neutron-lib contains the qos constants now, and neutron is moving to it
in I6ed379b178a2b79fd14385a1d1e87d87eb04bfb9. This patch moves all
references from neutron's qos constants to neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I2d7aba76dd81e4ba00d7fc9e57cd97efab40f18d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/42/487542/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.services.qos import constants as qos_consts

commit_message:
use qos DriverBase from neutron-lib

neutron-lib contains the QoS DriverBase class and neutron is moving
to it in Ic8027b73f82d691bd3c465061a4c8d8301288b07. This patch
updates reference of such to also use neutron-lib.

Change-Id: If69880187b0914a79cea0dddcc0cf8914c62337d

commit_message:
Eliminate randomness in encode_name&encode_host_name methods

Use 'md5' instead of 'hash' to generate a
shorter lun name and host name for Huawei backend.

Change-Id: Ie0361f47ed7947b368888859b488ae87615569e0
Closes-Bug: #1658725

commit_message:
[BugFix] Add 'instance_uuid' in update_attachment API

There are some issues around new attach/detach API/CLI,
fix them step by step. This patch add 'instance_uuid'
support in update_attachment API.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1675992

Change-Id: I43267340647c19215df18a77c49e227822a3ed32

commit_message:
Add auto-generated config reference

oslo.config provides sphinx extensions to generate config reference
and sample config files. This commit enables the auto-generation of
the networking config reference.

Part of doc-migration work

Change-Id: I1e5323328c5e8f09dc291ee7d083e2d6c7638a9c

commit_message:
Improve oslo-config-generator setting

* Use oslo-config-generator config file to generate ml2_conf.ini.
  This can be used by oslo_config sphinxext in a follow-up patch.
* Generate metadata_agent.ini sample automatically.
  Previously metadata_agent.ini was maintained manually.
* Update .gitignore not to ignore etc directory.
  I see no good reason not to maintain etc directory in the repo.
* Update devstack plugin to ensure the output directory
  where the ml2_conf sample file will be generated.

Preparation for auto-generated config reference
as part of doc-migration community-wide effort.

Change-Id: I64c6c66f9e14b558733254e9c9c2c64d647b70f8

commit_message:
Allow specification of only neutron net without subnet

in addition to existing approach where we are allowed to choose only
network with specific subnet.
It is useful when we have lots of small subnets and it is possible
to exceed amount of available IP addresses in it. In this case, we
will allow user to specify only network and delegate subnet choice
to server.

Change-Id: I23c21fe65552c0def527c98a5fa6a4eae56a6a7a

commit_message:
Configure regional mirrors for our jobs

In zuulv3 we no longer have access to the configure_mirrors.sh
ready-script in nodepool, as a result we are not using any regional
mirrors today.  This attempts to fix it by setting up /etc/pip.conf to
use our mirrors.

We also need to collect facts, as configure-mirror depends on them.

Change-Id: Idbf486f65b2c0a3701e48f7503b4affa3606b50f
Depends-On: Iebee5f1533786ff10eca889d8cb896cc848c864b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Rename to openstack-base for top-level job

As we start to bring zuul-base-jobs online, to avoid confusing rename
our base job to openstack-base.  This way we know which base we are
referring too.

Change-Id: I4733eb215b599adb9964be664efce66889586214
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable verify_host for synchronize

There is no need to have this disabled (seems to be by default). We
already have ensured our SSH hostkeys have been setup properly.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] Make cache-devstack optional for image builds

Move symlink of /home/jenkins/cache/files to cache-devstack, since it
is cache-devstack that create the files. This means that
cache-devstack will now depend on jenkins-slave.

Change-Id: Ief51016d1dda2afa13655e5e7e82720c3beea9ad
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/21/461521/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # a lot of caching happens in extra-data.d (for "historical" reasons). # We've put the cache stuff into /opt/cache/files, but again, for # "historical" reasons, ensure this is available in /home/jenkins mkdir -p /home/jenkins/cache ln -sf /opt/cache/files /home/jenkins/cache/files chown -R jenkins:jenkins /opt/cache/files

commit_message:
devstack: Drop forcing config drive.

Now that we support metadata, stop forcing config drive, even if
metadata is disabled.

Change-Id: I53a5cfae88eac3dc032665107f313b37c904be6d
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

added_lines: if is_service_enabled n-api-meta && is_service_enabled networking-ovn-metadata-agent ; then iniset $NOVA_CONF neutron service_metadata_proxy True
deleted_lines: # NOTE(rtheis): OVN currently lacks support for metadata so enabling # config drive is required to provide metadata to instances. if is_service_enabled n-api-meta ; then if is_service_enabled networking-ovn-metadata-agent ; then iniset $NOVA_CONF neutron service_metadata_proxy True else iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT force_config_drive True fi

added_lines: # Our returned object should have elements that proves it is a real # Barbican client object. We shouldn't use `isinstance` because that's # an evil pattern, instead we can check for very unique things in the # stable client API like "register_consumer", since this should fairly # reliably prove we're dealing with a Barbican client. self.assertTrue(hasattr(bc1, 'containers') and hasattr(bc1.containers, 'register_consumer'))
deleted_lines: from barbicanclient import client as barbican_client # Our returned client should be an instance of barbican_client.Client self.assertIsInstance( bc1, barbican_client.Client )

subject: Revert "Use caching reverse proxy for pypi"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 20:31:39.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/a1a40066042b0b6b3e59a53bf5ccf471caa8be08', 'message': 'Revert "Use caching reverse proxy for pypi"

This reverts commit 18cfa2598c0d5a04cb6543610b6a0c4cd5cd4bde.

This didn't catastrophically fail but we are seeing that when new
releases to python packages are made our cached indexes for these
packages are lagging in noticeable ways. We can likely get away with
this for the most part but it desynchonizes the afs volume releases
across regions and could possibly cause problems with timing as we get
into release time.

Change-Id: Ib50545f9cab0ba583127450e2c83a0c464c6f68a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Use caching reverse proxy for pypi"

This reverts commit 18cfa2598c0d5a04cb6543610b6a0c4cd5cd4bde.

This didn't catastrophically fail but we are seeing that when new
releases to python packages are made our cached indexes for these
packages are lagging in noticeable ways. We can likely get away with
this for the most part but it desynchonizes the afs volume releases
across regions and could possibly cause problems with timing as we get
into release time.

Change-Id: Ib50545f9cab0ba583127450e2c83a0c464c6f68a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/83/491083/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Temporary pip config edit to test pypi reverse proxy cache. # We want to run this in real world conditions to collect reliability # data with e-r before commiting to this on our images. sudo sed -i -e 's#\(index-url = https\?://mirror\..*\.openstack.org\)/#\1:8080/#' /etc/pip.conf

commit_message:
Remove redundant mock rpc statement

We already mocked the rpc component at our base
test class when initializing [1], remove the
redundant mock statements in testcases.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/test.py#L114

Change-Id: Iad96692c8dd71da7bf8bfa807bbd09a9dabb299a

fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/%s/qos-specs/%s' % (fake.PROJECT_ID, fake.UPDATE_FAILED_ID), use_admin_context=True) body = {'qos_specs': {'key1': 'value1', 'key2': 'value2'}} self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPInternalServerError, self.controller.update, req, fake.UPDATE_FAILED_ID, body) self.assertEqual(1, notifier.get_notification_count())

commit_message:
Don't duplicate and shadow CGIT_URL

The openstack_election,utils module contains the path to the OpenStack
cgit.  Don't duplicate that in generate-rolls.  Also use the more
appropriate name for the URL to the owners module.

Change-Id: I268aaab07df25cdd36c55d224340cf816f32a463

commit_message:
Use the tag when grabbing the projects list

The helper that added the tag to the cgit url was incorrectly appending
a simple "?tag" rather than "?h=tag"  cgit treats the tag as an unknown
option and is silently ignoring it.

Correct that.

The impact on the election is that any candidacies may have validated
may have included extra-atcs or repos added by the TV after the tagging
of the repo.  Checking the governance repo we see:

$ git log --no-merges --oneline aug-2017-elections..origin/master -- reference/projects.yaml
9b64bcb Adds oswin-tempest-plugin for Winstackers

This change clearly only affects the Winstackers candidates.

Change-Id: I1dfc47cb41aac4ce70d280e860ee4536cb90fd17

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 23:59:29.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ara.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/db4926f2e20bff6920f5bc781ec8265e1a1fef97', 'message': 'Enable minimum CentOS repositories

This is a "backport" from the OSA change introduced in
I2ac5a9c463991e4668a3e7608831c1944377e85e.

The CentOS CI images have many yum repositories enabled by default.
This can cause package conflicts in gate jobs and it doesn't match
what a basic CentOS system would look like for an OpenStack-Ansible
deployer.

This patch disables all repositories for the ansible-role-jobs and
only enables base, epel, and updates. This allows individual roles
to add extra repositories when they need them.

Change-Id: I8fea27726eb674aeb1656f05613b0ebd2cb761bb
Related-Bug: 1708493
'}]
commit_message:
Enable minimum CentOS repositories

This is a "backport" from the OSA change introduced in
I2ac5a9c463991e4668a3e7608831c1944377e85e.

The CentOS CI images have many yum repositories enabled by default.
This can cause package conflicts in gate jobs and it doesn't match
what a basic CentOS system would look like for an OpenStack-Ansible
deployer.

This patch disables all repositories for the ansible-role-jobs and
only enables base, epel, and updates. This allows individual roles
to add extra repositories when they need them.

Change-Id: I8fea27726eb674aeb1656f05613b0ebd2cb761bb
Related-Bug: 1708493
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/35/491135/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mhayden): The CentOS CI image has many repositories enabled by # default that can cause package conflicts. We must disable all of # them here and only enable base, updates, and epel. if [[ -e /usr/bin/yum ]] && [[ -x /usr/bin/yum-config-manager ]]; then sudo yum-config-manager --disable \* sudo yum-config-manager --enable base sudo yum-config-manager --enable epel sudo yum-config-manager --enable updates # NOTE(mhayden): EPEL is no longer required after installing distro # packages with bindep. Individual roles may re-enable EPEL if they # need it for their package installation tasks. if [[ -e /usr/bin/yum ]] && [[ -x /usr/bin/yum-config-manager ]]; then
deleted_lines: # EPEL must be enabled because some deps from bindep.txt are # otherwise not available if [[ -e /usr/bin/yum ]]; then sudo yum-config-manager --enable epel if [[ -e /usr/bin/yum ]]; then

commit_message:
Document using current-tripleo

We should be documenting using current-tripleo, as it is the pointer to
the most recently promoted DLRN repo. I have no idea what
current-passed-ci is, but I believe it refers to some downstream RDO CI,
not tripleo-ci.

Change-Id: Idd8060f5029e350715c62bb953ff4f71bd6fec1c

commit_message:
Add name and comment fields desc for instackenv

This commit adds documentation for two useful fields that are supported
and really useful in baremetal, name and _comment.

Change-Id: I52cc990b8fc1efb12931fabdd8600185fc535af6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/87/489587/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: There are also two additional and optional fields that can be used to help a user identifying machines inside ``instackenv.json`` file: * ``name`` - name associated to the node, it will appear in the ``Name`` column while listing nodes * ``_comment`` to associate a comment to the node (i.e. position, long description, etc.). Note that this field will not be considered by Ironic during the import For example:: { "nodes": [ { "name":"node-a", "pm_type":"ipmi", "mac":[ "fa:16:3e:2a:0e:36" ], "cpu":"2", "memory":"4096", "disk":"40", "arch":"x86_64", "pm_user":"admin", "pm_password":"password", "pm_addr":"10.0.0.8", "_comment": "Room 1 - Rack A - Unit 22/24" }, { "name":"node-b", "pm_type":"ipmi", "mac":[ "fa:16:3e:da:39:c9" ], "cpu":"2", "memory":"4096", "disk":"40", "arch":"x86_64", "pm_user":"admin", "pm_password":"password", "pm_addr":"10.0.0.15", "_comment": "Room 1 - Rack A - Unit 26/28" }, { "name":"node-n", "pm_type":"ipmi", "mac":[ "fa:16:3e:51:9b:68" ], "cpu":"2", "memory":"4096", "disk":"40", "arch":"x86_64", "pm_user":"admin", "pm_password":"password", "pm_addr":"10.0.0.16", "_comment": "Room 1 - Rack B - Unit 10/12" } ] }

commit_message:
Fix duplicate module names in Puppetfiles

Branch stable/newton already has that commit, this
will cause a duplicate warn because  Puppetfile in
puppet-openstack-integration will add puppet-tripleo
Puppetfile_extra twice.
Revert "rake_tasks: support Puppetfile_extras"
This reverts commit e122537c0aa9cd463edb8036dfa9ac93aa193c9a.

Change-Id: I53e321fc11034334160d08fcf079bc7e126adc14
Closes-Bug: 1708657
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper refs/changes/58/490858/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Allow to a repository to have extra modules that are not # in puppet-openstack-integration if File.exists?("#{Dir.pwd}/Puppetfile_extras") sh("cat #{Dir.pwd}/Puppetfile_extras >> #{repo}/Puppetfile") end

subject: Support cidr_networks in L3 network environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-23 02:07:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/319d36321d27a80b90a896eac9a34f0a0004389f', 'message': "[WIP] Support cidr_networks in L3 network environments

In some environments, a single container, storage, or tunnel network may
not be applicable to every host. Each configured provider_network would
need to be limited to a particular subset of hosts and the host var keys
within the inventory for container_address, storage_address, and
tunnel_address will need to be maintained since they're specifically
required by various playbooks.

Add two new options for configuring provider_networks, 'reference_group'
and 'address_prefix'.

'reference_group' for providing a group name that any host must
be a member of, in addition to any of the groups listed in
'group_binds', for the network to be applied.

'address_prefix' for overriding the name of the key created for each IP
address allocated by a cidr_network. By default, this key is named
'cidr_network'_address, where 'cidr_network' is the given 'ip_from_q'
option for a provider network.

Closes-Bug: 1650356

Change-Id: Ia7f3119f0affc4fb6be97ca788ca3b46096b82a8

commit_message:
Support cidr_networks in L3 network environments

In some environments, a single container, storage, or tunnel network may
not be applicable to every host. Each configured provider_network would
need to be limited to a particular subset of hosts and the host var keys
within the inventory for container_address, storage_address, and
tunnel_address will need to be maintained since they're specifically
required by various playbooks.

Add two new options for configuring provider_networks, 'reference_group'
and 'address_prefix'.

'reference_group' for providing a group name that any host must
be a member of, in addition to any of the groups listed in
'group_binds', for the network to be applied.

'address_prefix' for overriding the name of the key created for each IP
address allocated by a cidr_network. By default, this key is named
'cidr_network'_address, where 'cidr_network' is the given 'ip_from_q'
option for a provider network.

Closes-Bug: 1650356

Change-Id: Ia7f3119f0affc4fb6be97ca788ca3b46096b82a8

added_lines: static_routes, reference_group, address_prefix): :param reference_group: ``str`` group to compare and ensure membership of host against. :param address_prefix: ``str`` override prefix of key name for a network address. static_routes, reference_group, address_prefix if address_prefix: old_address = '%s_address' % address_prefix elif q_name: physical_host = container.get('physical_host') if reference_group and physical_host not in inventory.get(reference_group).get('hosts'): return static_routes=p_net.get('static_routes'), reference_group=p_net.get('reference_group'), address_prefix=p_net.get('address_prefix')

commit_message:
Create zuul_return_log_url in base-test job

Create a way for child jobs to override the log path for a job. An
example of this would be the tox-docs jobs wanting to set the path to
the html folder.

commit_message:
Prompt to clear breakpoints when using deployed-server

On a minor interactive update, we never prompoted to clear breakpoints
when using deployed-server since the code reads the server id's from
nova, of which there are none.

This modifies the behavior to read the server id's and names from Heat
when nova returns no servers.

Change-Id: I682f6dc66705c9d42b9c2d21f675491ea60c9c3c
Closes-Bug: #1708236
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/25/490125/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class DeployedServer(object): id = None name = None self.servers = self._get_servers() def _get_servers(self): servers = self.novaclient.servers.list() # If no servers were found from Nova, we must be using split-stack, # will have to interrogate Heat for the names and id's. if not servers: resources = self.heatclient.resources.list( self.stack.id, nested_depth=self.nested_depth, filters=dict(type="OS::Heat::DeployedServer")) for res in resources: server = DeployedServer() stack_name, stack_id = next( x['href'] for x in res.links if x['rel'] == 'stack').rsplit('/', 2)[1:] stack = self.heatclient.stacks.get(stack_id) server.name = next(o['output_value'] for o in stack.outputs if o['output_key'] == 'name') server.id = res.physical_resource_id servers.append(server) return servers

commit_message:
Fix creating LB with IP address

Previously, if you created a load balancer with an assigned IP address via
the Octavia V2 API the VIP would be created with an neutron assigned IP
address instead of the IP specified at LB creation time.
This patch corrects the behavior to have neutron attempt to use the IP
address specified, if there was one, when creating the VIP port.

Change-Id: If753b5761c5fc0550cbbc57e798363ff350304ad
Closes-Bug: #1695331
Co-Authored-By: Pradeep Kumar Singh <ps4openstack@gmail.com>

subject: Remove OSIC from the nodepool pool
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 19:18:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/e35bd3738b6286af069ff9092a346b62ba13996a', 'message': "Remove OSIC from the nodepool pool

Sadly the time has come where the OSIC cloud is needing to be fully
decom'd. It's with great sadness that write this commit message
and submit this PR however, as everyone is well aware, the OSIC
agreement between Rackspace and Intel has been discontinued for
some time and while Rackspace was able to keep the environment
online through feature freeze we must now sunset the environment
effective immediately.

I want to personally thank everyone within the community,
specifically the infrastructure team, for their time and effort
in using and supporting this source based publicly accessible
private cloud. The learnings we've had from this environment
have been invaluable and IMHO we've helped strengthen our
respective communities (deployer, operator, developer, users).
For me personally, It's been a wonderful experience building
and operating the OSIC and it's my hope that one day we can
do something like this again.

Change-Id: I2d1b0710e875bd1ebc305fb5b184b68bf18f2ef7
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-04 19:27:04.000000000', 'files': ['grafana/nodepool-osic.yaml', 'nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/7fe8e46f413b0cc5e0bb6b3a0d58bd790b70166d', 'message': "Remove OSIC from the nodepool pool

Sadly the time has come where the OSIC cloud is needing to be fully
decom'd. It's with great sadness that write this commit message
and submit this PR however, as everyone is well aware, the OSIC
agreement between Rackspace and Intel has been discontinued for
some time and while Rackspace was able to keep the environment
online through feature freeze we must now sunset the environment
effective immediately.

I want to personally thank everyone within the community,
specifically the infrastructure team, for their time and effort
in using and supporting this source based publicly accessible
private cloud. The learnings we've had from this environment
have been invaluable and IMHO we've helped strengthen our
respective communities (deployer, operator, developer, users).
For me personally, It's been a wonderful experience building
and operating the OSIC and it's my hope that one day we can
do something like this again.

Change-Id: I2d1b0710e875bd1ebc305fb5b184b68bf18f2ef7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove OSIC from the nodepool pool

Sadly the time has come where the OSIC cloud is needing to be fully
decom'd. It's with great sadness that write this commit message
and submit this PR however, as everyone is well aware, the OSIC
agreement between Rackspace and Intel has been discontinued for
some time and while Rackspace was able to keep the environment
online through feature freeze we must now sunset the environment
effective immediately.

I want to personally thank everyone within the community,
specifically the infrastructure team, for their time and effort
in using and supporting this source based publicly accessible
private cloud. The learnings we've had from this environment
have been invaluable and IMHO we've helped strengthen our
respective communities (deployer, operator, developer, users).
For me personally, It's been a wonderful experience building
and operating the OSIC and it's my hope that one day we can
do something like this again.

Change-Id: I2d1b0710e875bd1ebc305fb5b184b68bf18f2ef7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove datastore_name and datacenter_path

Two options (vmware_datacenter_path and vmware_datastore_name) in
the VMware driver were supposed to be removed as of Liberty and
its now Mitaka.

see:
https://github.com/openstack/glance_store/blob/master/glance_store/_drivers/vmware_datastore.py

Change-Id: Id13de4c2901fa0bcaaf04f7c356d7dbcdcbed365

added_lines: Hello everyone, I would like to announce my candidacy for PTL of Cloudkitty. During the Pike cycle we have been able continue the openess of our community but also the addition of some interesting improvment and bug fixes. Now with Queen cycle approacing fast, my main focus for cloudkitty will be to expand the spectrum of interaction : toward more OpenStack components and toward containers. Finally I would like a special focus with documentation to help to adoption of cloudkitty ! I would also like to take this opportunity to thank all members of the OpenStack community who helped our team during the lasts cycles. Thank you, Christophe

commit_message:
Adding Chason Chan(chenxing) candidacy for Documentation

Change-Id: Id48ca4719f04c1b0f80709e53afc0bc52045278d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/19/491019/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hello everyone, I would like to announce my candidacy for Documentation PTL (Queens). First of all, I wish to introduce myself briefly. I have been working on the bugs of openstack-manuals project since the Liberty release. And the most I fixed is the bugs of the Install Guide. In my opinion, Openstack is not very friendly with new hand. If they install their first openstack environment according to our Install Guide which may not be very accurate, she or he would be in a mess. I will continue to focus on document bugs whether as a reviewer or PTL. In this cycle, Alex( asettle) has coordinated the doc migration work [1]. I wish to take this opportunity to thank all members of the OpenStack community who partcipated in this work. We cannot achieve such seriously bug stuff without your cooperation. :) As you can see, we removed several guides from openstack-manuals project. There are still many things [2] we have not yet to accomplished after the doc migration. Some of these problems we already have solutions. But the others need to be discussed. We are welcome everyone to join in our discussion[3]. It would be wonderful if you can give us some ideas! If I am elected PTL of the Documentation project, my focuses for the coming release are to grow the Documentation team, keep the accuracy of documents, and work closely with other projects to help them imporve documents. Thanks for your consideration, and I am looking forward to work together with all of you on getting the OpenStack documents to the next stage. Cheers, Chason Email: chen.xing@99cloud.net IRC: chason Launchpad: chen-xing [1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/doc-migration-tracking [2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/doc-future-problems [3] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/denver-doc-PTG

commit_message:
Implement uWSGI for heat api services

As part of the Pike goals we are moving api services to run as WSGI
apps. heat-api, heat-api-cfn, and heat-api-cloudwatch are now set
up as WSGI apps.

Since this is just a drop in replacement for existing eventlet services,
operators and deployers should not notice a difference.

Change-Id: I3dba17c33a7f1a1b9a03020a650e258099b4d20d
Implements: blueprint goal-deploy-api-in-wsgi

commit_message:
add watched queries to list-changes

Add a data file for defining gerrit queries so we can track incomplete
work for known initiatives when reviewing releases. Include a query
for patches owned by the proposal bot (to watch for requirements
updates and other automated changes) and another to watch for
documentation file updates (to let us monitor the doc migration
initiative for pike).

Change-Id: I12c59d83267bf80773876e81b3470bfe3062ad27
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/80/490880/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- # The template string shows how to format the info for each review. # A review contains: # {'_number': 490743, # 'mergeable': True, # 'subject': 'Updated from global requirements', # 'project': 'openstack/congress', # 'owner': {'_account_id': 11131}, # 'branch': 'master', # 'insertions': 1, # 'created': '2017-08-04 04:31:47.000000000', # 'deletions': 1, # 'id': 'openstack%2Fcongress~master~I52e06d42a25e1780984fbf37fe9cd2c7e4bc8a9f', # 'hashtags': [], # 'topic': 'openstack/requirements', # 'status': 'NEW', # 'updated': '2017-08-04 11:12:50.000000000', # 'change_id': 'I52e06d42a25e1780984fbf37fe9cd2c7e4bc8a9f'} template: | [{status}] {subject} Updated: {updated} Topic: {topic} https://review.openstack.org/{_number} # The query items need a title, to be displayed above the output, and # a query string. The query string can include {branch} and {project}, # which will be replaced with the full branch name and the git # repository name respectively. queries: - title: Open patches from the proposal bot query: "is:open branch:{branch} project:{project} owner:proposal-bot" - title: Documentation patches query: "is:open branch:{branch} project:{project} path:^doc/source/.*"

commit_message:
Deprecate Spark 1.3.1

Spark 1.3.1 came out in Liberty, and was quickly succeeded in Mitaka
with Spark 1.6.0, so it is safe to deprecate.

Change-Id: Ic1a1cf579c5e73a71e44992ea49434db7c4bcf96

commit_message:
Better keystonemiddleware log level

To get rid of pesky "Rejecting request" messages in the logs.
Also, remove log level for "keystone" since that would never
be in Sahara logs anyway.

Change-Id: I6c58f24f1160cd66d2b76be317b9bb2294267a25
Closes-Bug: #1708690
Co-Authored-By: Kristi Nikolla <knikolla@bu.edu>
